body:
Comment 2 by **carlchatfield**: 
Thank you for that. Re-reading http://golang.org/ref/spec#Assignments
I found this example which makes it clear that the examples you give
above are legal.

var w int64 = 1.0<<33  // 1.0<<33 is a constant shift expression

However, I changing the above example to

var x float32 = 1.0<<33 // 1.0<<33 is a constant shift expression

which clearly shows that the "type of the constant is what it would be if the shift
expression were replaced by its left operand alone" mechanism only comes into play "if
the left operand of a non-constant shift expression".
